intro: Bourreria bullata, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red, tubular flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting hummingbirds and other pollinators. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Bourreria bullata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in warm, tropical climates.
